New Records: The White Sox tied the Mets' record for most losses in a season on Sunday night in San Diego.
Key Match Events: The White Sox came back from a 2-0 deficit in the 8th inning to tie the game, and then Benintendi scored the winning run in the same inning.
Justin Anderson locked down his first save of the season, which was only the team's 20th all year, compared to 36 blown saves.
Pre-Game Insights: The announced crowd was right around their season average, and it was also 'Fan Appreciation Week' and 'Dog Day'.
Post-Match Reflections: Benintendi said the team was 'glad we got it done tonight' and that the first comeback win coming this late in the season was 'hard to believe'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked the start of 'Fan Appreciation Week', and it was also 'Dog Day', where fans could bring their pooches and sit in the outfield.
The announced crowd was right around their season average.
Others: The White Sox were 0-94 when trailing after seven innings this season, but they came back to win the game.
Cannon got out of a jam in the fifth inning when four White Sox players converged and allowed a fly ball to drop between them down the first base line.
